Did you check the links on the FIRST Choice product page?

Dig in a little, and you’ll see this example to use it for a USB HID device which could make a custom button panel on your driver station: PSoC 5LP Operator Interface Example for the FIRST ... - Infineon Developer Community

If you need a little inspiration on switches, try using your Digi-Key voucher. If you want to get even wilder, some of the switch designs available through Makers Making Change are easily 3D printed. (You can solder wires straight to the board and skip the 3.5mm audio cable, that’s just the standard interface in the accessibility world.) I suggest the Interact Switch, Light Touch Switch, or Raindrop Switch for a first swing, as the needed electronic parts are available through the Digi-Key voucher.

If I was starting from an empty cabinet, I’d probably just throw a Pi Pico or another RP2040 board at it. CircuitPython makes it easy for any low-talent hack to generate HID output (source: am that low-talent hack), and projects like GP2040-CE make it even easier now.

But if you’ve got these in-hand, might as well!
